edu.cpp.cs.cs141.spyvsninjaassasins

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.spyvsninjaassasins.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    AAnthony The GameEngine is in charge of executing code that will maintain/control the games internal functions, numbers, etc. based on the inputs given in the UI.

    • Constructor Summary

      GameEngine()

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()

    • Method Detail

      • generateBoard

        public void generateBoard()
        Calls to the grid to generate the board.

      • generateBoard

        public void generateBoard(int lives)
        Alternate generateBoard method; generates the board with the players lives set to the argument passed onto the lives parameter when called. Used for starting the next level and when loading a file.

      • look

        public java.lang.String look(char direction)
        Method in charge of allowing the user to look in a given direction. Has a char parameter that is used to tell the program which way the user wanted to look.

      • endLook

        public void endLook(char direction)
        If the player looked in a space that was not a room or out of bounds area, this method will set the object to be invisible again after the player moves or fires.

      • shoot

        public java.lang.String shoot(char direction)
        Method in charge of allowing the user to shoot in any direction. String argument determines which direction the user wants to shoot [inputted from the user in the UI].

      • movePlayer

        public boolean movePlayer(char direction)
        Method in charge of moving the player's position on the board based on the char argument used when called upon.

      • moveEnemies

        public void moveEnemies()
        After the player's choice of movement, this method moves the Enemies based on their difficulty and scenario [IE. random movement vs. chasing the user (for hard mode)].

      • endTurnFunctions

        public void endTurnFunctions()
        At the end of each turn, if the player is not in god mode, this method will lower the player's shield counter by 1.

      • levelReset

        public void levelReset()
        Calls to the GameBoard's deleteBoard() method.

      • gameReset

        public void gameReset()
        Deletes the existing board, and resets the game's level and enemiesAlive fields to their initial values (used for starting fresh/new games).

      • increaseLevel

        public void increaseLevel()
        Increases the level field by one and sets the enemies to the level + 5. Used to increase the level for when the user beats a level.

      • saveFile

        public java.lang.String saveFile(java.io.File file)
        This method is in charge of writing the game's current status into a .dat file with a name specified by the user.

      • loadFile

        public java.lang.String loadFile(java.io.File file)
        This method is in charge of reading and loading any selected save data.

      • executeDebug

        public void executeDebug()
        Method used to toggle debug mode. Calls various methods to modify the game state to execute debug mode.

      • executeGod

        public void executeGod()
        Acts in the same respect as executeDebug, except this method also increases the players invincibility, to avoid death.

      • unstuck

        public void unstuck()
        Calls to the GameBoard method unstuck().

      • checkDeath

        public void checkDeath(Player player)
        Checks whether or not an enemy has overwritten the players space. If the player does not exist on the board, then he/she is dead and thus respawned in his/her init position with one less life. If an enemy is in the player's spawn point, it will be respawned elsewhere.

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin()
        This method checks whether or not he/she has found the briefcase, whenever the player has entered one of the nine rooms.

      • checkMode

        public boolean checkMode(java.lang.String mode)
        Method used in the GUI GameFrame class. Determines which mode the player is in, so as to determine which radio button will be selected.

      • checkExists

        public boolean checkExists(int i,
                           int j)
        Calls the GameBoard's checkExists() method.

      • checkInvincibility

        public boolean checkInvincibility()
        Used when the UI is displaying the board. If the player is still invincible, it will return true, which will show the message to the player after a move is done. If the player is not invincible, it will return false, and the message will not be shown.

      • scanFor

        public boolean scanFor(java.lang.String type)
        Calls to the GameBoard's scanFor() method.

      • enemyIsVisible

        public boolean enemyIsVisible()
        Checks if there is an enemy that is visible. Used in the GameFrame's generate text method for certain cases.

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible(int i,
                         int j)

      • getType

        public char getType(int i,
                    int j)

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()

      • getLives

        public int getLives()

      • getBullets

        public int getBullets()

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()

        public int getEnemies()

        public char getDirection(int row,

        public boolean getGodMode()

        public void setPreDebugBullets(int bullets)
